revised_title: On the Calculus of Symbols: Second Memoir
tldr: The author extends the Calculus of Symbols, a mathematical method for resolving functions of non-commutative symbols into binomial factors. They explore methods for finding the highest common internal divisor of two functions of non-commutative symbols, multiplying linear factors, and calculating coefficients in the binomial theorem. The author also investigates a binomial theorem reciprocal to the previously considered binomial theorem and resolves symbolical functions into factors.
